DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to assess whether smaller volumes of oral dexamethasone result in better tolerability, specifically less vomiting, in pediatric patients during an acute asthma exacerbation.
DOC.brief_title: Dexamethasone Tolerability in the Treatment of Acute Asthma in Children
DOC.criteria: acute asthma exacerbation requiring oral systemic corticosteroids for management preference for pills over liquid formulation history of Nissen fundoplication surgery needed immediate airway intervention require oral medications to be given via a G or J tube if patient care would be compromised enrolled in the study on a previous visit.
